alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 1:17PM CDT until August 22 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Texas and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Hill. In north central Texas, Navarro. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Corsicana, Kerens, Blooming Grove, Angus, Barry, Navarro, Rice, Frost, Retreat, Oak Valley, Mildred, Eureka, Malone, Goodlow, Powell, Emhouse, Mertens and Mustang.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
